Updates for the 2020-2021 School Year,

This past Friday the Department of Education, in conjunction with Governor Eric Holcomb’s office and the Indiana Department of Health, released guidelines for the safe return of students and staff to school for the 2020-21 school year. Orleans Community Schools currently has a team of staff members working on reentry plans using this new guidance, as well as feedback from our recent parent survey data, the Small Schools Joint Coalition, the Orange County Health Department, and the Orleans Classroom Teachers Association.

Many options are being considered, including virtual online options if necessary.

Our finalized reentry plan will be shared with the community once we have completed it and the school board has approved it. Please understand that this is a complicated issue, and that the safety of our students and staff remains our top priority.

Thank you for supporting Orleans Community Schools. We are in this together.

Teletherapy services for students in grades 7-12 are officially available! After two years of work, Orleans Jr-Sr High, IU Health, CareSource, and the Indiana Rural Health Association have created a hub of licensed therapists who will provide virtual services for enrolled students.

Services are billed through a student’s family insurance, however no student who qualifies will be turned away. Rather than missing days of instruction, and parents taking off work to drive their child to therapy, students will only miss up to 30 min per week, and parents can stay at work.

We’re proud to be the first school in southern Indiana to provide services of this kind. If you are interested in more information about these services, please contact the office.
